* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hour:

Business Management 1 focuses on exploring local, national, and international business activities. This course will teach students the basic theories and principles of business organization and management in modern society, allowing students to develop an understanding of today’s complex and dynamic business environment. The conceptual learning is firmly anchored in business management theories, tools, and techniques and placed in the context of real-world examples and case studies. Students will learn how to use and apply useful business concepts, tools, and terminology while exploring key business aspects in different situations, and be able to develop a range of business management skills relevant to their life, university study, or the world of work.
* Text Books/Lecture Notes:
[1] Nickels, W. G., McHugh, J., & McHugh, S. (2019). Understanding Business (12th ed.). New York, NY: McGraw-Hill Education
* Additional references:
[2] Nguyen Ngoc Huyen (2013). Giáo trình Quản Trị Kinh Doanh, tập 1. NEU Publishing House
[3] Ronald J. Ebert, Ricky W. Griffin, (2016). Business Essentials (11th ed.). Pearson

content.text: Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).

Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proof must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.

Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.

* Kind of the course:
* Course language: In English
* Meeting hour:
Business Management 1 focuses on exploring local, national, and international business activities. This course will teach students the basic theories and principles of business organization and management in modern society, allowing students to develop an understanding of today’s complex and dynamic business environment. The conceptual learning is firmly anchored in business management theories, tools, and techniques and placed in the context of real-world examples and case studies. Students will learn how to use and apply useful business concepts, tools, and terminology while exploring key business aspects in different situations, and be able to develop a range of business management skills relevant to their life, university study, or the world of work.

Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proof must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
